DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether 100mg erlotinib had similar effect compared with 150mg erlotinib in NSCLC patients with EGFR mutation in China.
DOC.brief_title: Erlotinib 100mg or 150mg in Treating EGFR Mutated NSCLC
DOC.detailed_description: In China it was confirmed that 150mg Erlotinib was effective in NSCLC patients wtih EGFR mutation, but reducing dose occurring in some patients because of the drug related side-effects. Thus, we sought to investigate that in Chinese patients with EGFR mutation whether low dose (100mg) Erlotinib had similar efficacy but lower toxcities compared with standad dose (150mg) Erlotinib.
DOC.criteria: 1. Histological diagnosis of NSCLC with phase IIIB or IV disease; 2. Sensitive mutation EGFR gene (18, 19 del, 21 L858R gene mutation) (mutation detection methods:ARMSPCR, sequence method) 3. Never received antitumor therapies for the advanced stage; 4. Never used EGFR inhibitors; 5. Measurable disease by RECIST criteria; 6. Male or female patients >=18 years of age; 7. ECOG karnofsky performance 0~3, life expectancy is greater than 12 weeks; 8. Patients must be accessible for treatment and followup; 1. Previously used EGFR inhibitors 2. Mix ingredients in patients with squamous cell carcinoma, small cell lung cancer; 3. Allergic to erlotinib; 4. Nonmeasurable lesions 5. Pregnant or lactating women; 6. Patients having other factors that preventing researchers from enrollment them.
